intro: Pleurandra empetrifolia, commonly known as the rock pleurandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Araceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia, particularly in countries like Thailand and Vietnam. The plant is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that are adapted to arid and rocky environments. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white in color. Due to its unique appearance and hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in gardens and greenhouses.
